mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Mathers, William
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Aristocrats of Belmont county forced sale of his nail manufactory and brick yard to pay losses occasioned in mercantile trade in New Orleans; refused property in Baltimore; asks $200 for two years to buy nail iron for cutting machine; encloses recommendation from Governor Tiffin.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1806 August 22, St. Clairsville, [Ohio], to Thomas Jefferson, [Washington, D.C.].
